Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

Returns: True if the session's queue is paused.
isQueuePaused().Description: Returns true if the session's queue is paused.

Returns: The session state. One of @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaSessionStatus#SESSION_STATE_ACTIVE_E@, @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaSessionStatus#SESSION_STATE_ENDED_E@, or @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaSessionStatus#SESSION_STATE_INVALIDATED_E@.
The new instance, or null if the bundle was null.
Parameters: Bundle: The bundle, or null if none.
fromBundle(android.os.Bundle).Description: Creates an instance from a bundle.

Returns: The status timestamp in the @B_android#os#SystemClock#elapsedRealtime_E@ time base.
getTimestamp().Description: Gets the timestamp associated with the status information in milliseconds since boot in the @B_android#os#SystemClock#elapsedRealtime_E@ time base.

Returns: The contents of the object represented as a bundle.
asBundle().Description: Converts this object to a bundle for serialization.

getExtras().Description: Gets a bundle of extras for this status object. The extras will be ignored by the media router but they may be used by applications.

ClassDesc: Describes the playback status of a media session. This class is part of the remote playback protocol described by the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent_E@ class. When a media session is created, it is initially in the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaSessionStatus#SESSION_STATE_ACTIVE_E@ state. When the media session ends normally, it transitions to the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaSessionStatus#SESSION_STATE_ENDED_E@ state. If the media session is invalidated due to another session forcibly taking control of the route, then it transitions to the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaSessionStatus#SESSION_STATE_INVALIDATED_E@ state. Refer to the documentation of each state for an explanation of its meaning. To monitor session status, the application should supply a https:##developer#android#com@B_android#app#PendingIntent_E@ to use as the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent#EXTRA_SESSION_STATUS_UPDATE_RECEIVER_E@ for a given @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent#ACTION_START_SESSION_E@. This object is immutable once created using a @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaSessionStatus#Builder_E@ instance.
